intro: Platyclinis kingii, commonly known as the King's flat-leaf, is a species of flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant features narrow, lance-shaped leaves that are typically arranged in a basal rosette, and it produces small, yellow flowers that bloom in spring. Platyclinis kingii is often found in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to arid environments. Its ornamental value has made it a sought-after plant in horticulture, though it is relatively rare in cultivation.
